Carbon monoxide poisoning

Carbon monoxide poisoning CO binds avidly to Hb (affinity 240x > O2) forming carboxyhaemoglobin COHb.

Brain injury occurs. 3% die, 33% have neurological symptoms at 1yr if treated with 100% O2 (half that many if treated with hyperbaric O2).

Causes hypoxia (COHb, leftshift HC curve)

Lipid peroxidation (immune activation)

Inhibits cytochrome c (see mitochondrial metabolism )

t Â½ of COHb is: 240 minutes breathing air, 40 minutes breathing 100% O2 , and 20 minutes on 100% O2 at 3 atm.
